abstract: Morgan Stanley, United Technologies and General Electric are asking Congress to waive tax penalties on businesses that borrow from their offshore units, Congressional aides and lobbyists told Bloomberg News.
lead_paragraph: Morgan Stanley, United Technologies and General Electric are asking Congress to waive tax penalties on businesses that borrow from their offshore units, Congressional aides and lobbyists told Bloomberg News.

headline.main: Morgan Stanley and G.E. Seek Tax Waiver on Loans

abstract: New York’s attorney general ordered an overhaul of the way insurers decide what to pay for out-of-network care.
snippet: New York’s attorney general ordered an overhaul of the way insurers decide what to pay for out-of-network care.
lead_paragraph: In a settlement with one of the nation’s biggest insurers, New York’s attorney general, Andrew M. Cuomo, has ordered an overhaul of the databases the industry uses to determine how much of a medical bill is paid when a patient uses an out-of-network doctor.

headline.main: Big Health Insurer Agrees to Update Its Fee Data
headline.print_headline: Big Insurer To Update Its Fee Data

byline.original: By Danny Hakim and Reed Abelson
